flawed_nl_solution:
12 mph faster than 60mph is 60+12=<<60+12=72>>72 mph.
18 mph slower than 60 mph is 60-18=<<60-18=24>>24 mph.
If he spends 1/3 of the time at each of these three speeds, then he averages (60+72+24)/3 = <<(60+72+24)/3=52>>52 mph.
#### 52

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 42, not 24. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
